verses.kjv: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;
verses.ct: When Israel came out of Egypt, when Jacob's descendants left a nation that spoke a foreign tongue,

verses.kjv: Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.
verses.ct: Judah became God's holy place, and Israel became his kingdom.

verses.kjv: The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.
verses.ct: The sea looked and ran away; the Jordan River turned back.

verses.kjv: The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.
verses.ct: The mountains leaped like rams, and the hills jumped like lambs.

verses.kjv: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?
verses.ct: What happened to you, sea, that you ran away? Jordan, why did you turn back?

verses.kjv: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?
verses.ct: Mountains, why did you leap like rams? Hills, why did you jump like lambs?

verses.kjv: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;
verses.ct: Shake in awe, earth, in the presence of the Lord, in the presence of the God of Jacob,

verses.kjv: Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.
verses.ct: who transformed solid rock into a pool of water, and hard stone into a flowing spring.
